definition: to feel with the hand/to touch/to stroke/to grope/to steal/to abstract

sentences.english: I estimated that I would save at least two hours of driving time.
sentences.chinese: 我估摸着至少能節省2個小時。

sentences.english: I guess school can be pretty traumatizing for some of us.
sentences.chinese: 我估摸學校可能給我們帶來一些心靈創傷。

sentences.english: I think he figured maybe no one would come in if they saw him at the door.
sentences.chinese: 我想，他這是估摸着要是見他在門口，沒人會進來。

sentences.english: A large group of children could be seen there, approximately one or two hundred in number.
sentences.chinese: 只見一大羣孩子，目視過去估摸着差不多有一兩百個。

sentences.english: Jim said he reckoned I would believe him next time.
sentences.chinese: 傑姆說，他估摸，下回我會信他的話。

sentences.english: "I reckon she's agoin' to be pretty late ag'in tonight, Jim, " he remarked in a squeaky falsetto.
sentences.chinese: 吉姆，我估摸着這趟車今夜又要晚點很久。

definition: to weigh in the hand/to consider/to ponder
to carve and polish (jade)/to polish and refine a literary work
to ponder/to mull over/to think through/Taiwan pr. [zhuo2 mo2]
most likely/mostly (in 8 or 9 cases out of 10)/vast majority
to ponder/to reckon/to turn sth over in one's mind
